before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"77vri","text":"To avoid warming up Matrigel stock, work deliberately and ensure that all the plastic materials you will need are in the cell culture hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"30ftq","text":"Matrigel is used to pre-coat cell culture dishes and provide an attachment surface for feeder-free human iPS cells to replicate on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kuq4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e600k","text":"We use Matrigel from Corning (product number) that is provided in a glass bottle as a concentrated liquid (5ml) with lot-specific dilution information. You can look up the Dilution Factor here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mvbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q03q","text":"In the JAX Cellular Engineering lab, we use this lot-specific dilution factor to calculate the volume of cold DMEM/F12 to add to the concentrated 5ml Matrigel so that the final concentration is at 40X. The 40X stock solution is aliquoted to 1ml cryovials (0.5ml volume) and stored in a dedicated box in the -20°C freezer. Individual aliquots are thawed and used to further dilute to 1X directly in a cell culture dish prior to plating iPS cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36mrq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c63j2","text":"Within our CRISPR editing/single cell cloning pipeline, we most often use Matrigel coated plates in the following 2 protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gd37","text":"1. Coating wells of a 24W plate to grow small volumes of iPS cells thawed from Matrix plate minivials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5277e","text":"2. Coating wells of a 96W plate to grow picked iPS cell colonies during the clone isolation stage of single cell cloning","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cadl","text":"- Matrigel will solidify if warmed up. Work with Matrigel stock while it is cold and only dilute into cold serum-free media (ex. DMEM/F12)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e29rg","text":"- Matrigel 40X stock is stored in 1ml cryovials in the -20°C. Each cryovial contains 500ul. Once thawed, you can store the stock cryovial at 4°C and use it as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ej6t","text":"- Do not let Matrigel-coated plates dry out","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t865","text":"- Matrigel coated plates can be wrapped in parafilm and stored at 4°C for a few days as long as the excess liquid is not removed from the well. Warm these up to 37°C before aspirating liquid and adding cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"2koeh","text":"24W or 96W flat bottom cell culture-treated plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bk0k","text":"5-ml or 15-ml conical tube for mixing 1X Matrigel prior to distribution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdoc5","text":"Sterile 25ml reservoirs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiaui","text":"COLD DMEM/F12 or other serum-free media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8ugc","text":"COLD 40X Matrigel stock cryovials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5s8nt","text":"24W plate:  In an appropriate-sized tube, prepare enough 1X Matrigel to distribute 300-500ul of solution to each well of the 24W plate as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etftd","text":"Working quickly, dilute cold 40X Matrigel 1:40 in cold DMEM/F12. This works out to 25ul of 40X Matrigel for every 1ml of DMEM/F12","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lal6","text":"Mix by pipetting and distribute 300-500ul to each well using the same pipet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sls2","text":"After incubation, aspirate the excess liquid. NOTE - the liquid will not bead up like Synthemax does. Have your cells or media on hand to add to the wells to prevent the Matrigel from drying out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mt25","text":"96W plate:  Prepare 1X Matrigel directly in a sterile reservoir with the intention of distributing 50ul per well using an 8- or 12-channel multichannel pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9sugq","text":"Working quickly, dilute cold 40X Matrigel 1:40 in cold DMEM/F12 directly in a reservoir in the hood. For each 96W plate you plan to coat, add 75ul of 40X Matrigel to 3ml of DMEM/F12","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vutq","text":"Mix directly in the reservoir with a 5ml pipet. Distribute 50ul to each well using a multichannel pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"egaso","text":"Tap the plate if necessary to ensure the liquid has covered the entire surface of each well. Incubate the plate at 37°C/5%CO2 for at least 2h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":124,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1h3ql","text":"Tap the plate if necessary to ensure the liquid has covered the entire surface of the well. Incubate the plate at 37°C/5%CO2 for at least 2h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":123,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gh6i","text":"After incubation, pipet off the excess liquid into a waste reservoir using a multichannel pipet. Have your cells or media on hand to add to the wells to prevent the Matrigel from drying out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Matrigel coating cell culture plates
